Input Text: toyota complaint 230832 for natural vut fries with strange odor like rotten smell dear hagino thank you for bringing this matter to our attention i have promptly registered it in our system under case number 14059 we are sorry to hear that your customer was not satisfied with the quality of this batch the quality of our products is of utmost importance to us and we are committed to resolving this matter batch information lotcode g22 23 138 2044 production day 20230518 the description of the complaint suggests that a potato was affected by wet rot wet rot happens when potatoes near the surface of the soil have sat in water for some time as the name suggests this has caused the potato to rot leading to a strong unpleasant smell as it cant be seen visually the optical sorters in production cannot detect potatoes affected by wet rot however these kind of potatoes crumbledisintegrate in the steam peeler or blanchers unfortunately a potato that was alongside the affected potato can take on the smell as well we do have intake tests in all our production plants to try to eliminate potatoes that have wet rot if wet rot is detected during the quality tests at potato reception by a percentage of more than 2 the truck will be rejected as you know we also conduct qa tests on the end product whereby the product is tested regularly every hour by heating in the microwave if the product is affected by wet rot when heated it emits a strong pungent smell we can then stop production conduct further tests into production and block any affected stock based on the batch code i have conducted a thorough investigation into our production records and quality documents for the specific batch and can confirm that no remarks about an off smell were noted all quality checks on smell both of the frozen and of the heated product were ok i therefore believe that this issue will not be widespread please also be assured that potatoes affected by wet rot are entirely harmless and do not pose a health risk unfortunately due to the inherent nature of potatoes as a natural product it is impossible to avoid this at all times however we always strive to offer you the best possible product by conducting regular quality tests we apologize for any inconvenience that you may have suffered if you have any further concerns please dont hesitate to contact me

Provide your analysis focusing on:
- Precise root cause classification
- Relevant extra information
output:
Root Cause: no remarks during production packaging
Additional Information: nan

black parts by a second optical sorter and any defects are rejected using compressed air additionally small darkcolored foreign bodies are detected and rejected these initial steps are designed to
